name: Half-Life Determiner
tagline: Control software for a custom half-life measurement rig for the Aachen University Hospital.
shortDescription: For my Bachelor's thesis, I developed a control software for a custom half-life measurement rig the Nuclear Medicine department of the University Hospital of Aachen plans to build. The rig is used to measure the half-life of radiopharmaceuticals. The software was developed in C# using WPF and communicates with the sensors of the rig via a USB A/D converter. It features a live graph of the measured data with the fitted half-life curve and the ability to save and load measurements.

name: ELGIO
tagline: Event discovery platform with ticketing service.
shortDescription: ELGIO is an event discovery platform with its own ticketing service that I built together with two friends. It consists of a web app and a dashboard written in React. It once had a now deprecated mobile app for users and has one ticket scanning app. Both were written in Flutter. The backend uses different Firebase services for authentication, storage, serverless functions and database. A scraper written in Python using BeautifulSoup and Selenium is used to get event data from different sources.

name: Küchen Krieg
tagline: A multiplayer top-down shooter game set in a kitchen.
shortDescription: Küchen Krieg is a game I developed together with two fellow students as part of a university project for the course 'Multimedia Modal Madness'. It is a multiplayer top-down shooter game set in a kitchen, with one team playing as fruits and the other as vegetables. The game was developed in Unity and uses Mirror for networking.
